title: 2 Easy Ways to Reset or Change Your Spotify Password

steps.title: Go to https://www.spotify.com and sign in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.spotify.com and sign in. You'll need to use a mobile or desktop browser. Regardless of Spotify premium status, you can't change your password using the mobile app or desktop app. Use this method if you know your password and want to change it. Click Log in in the top-right corner, and enter your username or email and password. Click Log in again. If you use Facebook to log in to your Spotify account, you won't have a Spotify password to change, but you can change your Facebook password . You could also remove Spotify from Facebook if you want.

steps.title: Click your profile picture in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click your profile picture in the top-right corner. This will open a drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Account.
steps.content: Click Account . This is the very first option. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Change password.
steps.content: Click Change password . You can find this on the left panel, underneath Address .

steps.title: Enter your current password.
steps.content: Enter your current password. You must know your current password to use this method.

steps.title: Enter your new password twice.
steps.content: Enter your new password twice. Input your new password in the New password and Repeat new password field.

steps.title: Click Set new password.
steps.content: Click Set new password . This is the green button below the password fields. Your password is now changed. Log back into your account on the mobile or desktop app to use Spotify .

steps.title: Go to https://www.spotify.com/password-reset in a desktop or mobile browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.spotify.com/password-reset in a desktop or mobile browser. You'll see a field for your email address or username. [1] X Research source Use this method if you forgot your password and want to change it.

steps.title: Type your Spotify username or email address in the field.
steps.content: Type your Spotify username or email address in the field. Be sure to use the email address associated with your Spotify account.

steps.title: Click SEND.
steps.content: Click SEND . An email will be sent to the email address associated with your Spotify membership.

steps.title: Click the link inside the email from Spotify.
steps.content: Click the link inside the email from Spotify. The email header should be Reset your password . The sender should have an @spotify.com email. In most cases, it will be no-reply@spotify.com . Never click outgoing links from unfamiliar or unofficial emails. This will protect your email account from unauthorized access.

steps.title: Enter a new password in the labeled fields.
steps.content: Enter a new password in the labeled fields. Make sure to use a secure password that you can remember . You'll need to enter this password twice. Be sure they match in each field.

steps.title: Click Send.
steps.content: Click Send . This is the green button below the password fields. Your password is now changed. Log back into your account on the mobile or desktop app to use Spotify. If desired, you can also change your Spotify username.
